intro: Veronica bachofenii, commonly known as Bachofen's speedwell, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
